content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												It took me forever to set up my show and it still wasn't synced properly but that's ok. I love, love, love fireworks and this program is great. Any fan of fireworks will love this. Once you get the hang of it, it's easy to work with.PROSEasy to use drag and drop featureGraphics and water reflectionsDifferent angle camera POVsCustom Fireworks creatingYour own music importCONSInvisible fireworksLimited type of firework colors/setsLimited areas/scenery to create your show inAnnoying built-in music looping when creatingNo option to view from a certain point in your trackNo snap-to feature on the boat/docks for perfect alignmentAll saves vanishing if you delete an older save and no save overrideExtreme swapping lag from sequence to placement when you have a lot of fireworks on the sequence linesOverall, I really enjoy this simulator, even with it's many flaws. I can see myself putting tons of hours into it, just for the pure enjoyment of watching the entire finished fireworks show that I've created.As a side note, the Devs have abandoned this simulator. You will get no help from them, no updates, no bug fixes. Only the community can help you, but we are all having the same problems. Buying this game now is just paying the ones who don't care about their game or their community.

content:

												Overall great game if you WANT to create your own firework simulation in sync with music.Minor issues that could be fixed/improved:There should be mouse wheel scrolling in sequence editor,The firework when selected in placement should indicate which one you have selected,When playing the simulation you should be allowed to skip to a section you want to see,When creating a firework, it should allow you to clear the firework placed instead of clearing the whole rack,If the above were fixed it would be even better than it already is. number of helpful: 23 of 33 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												For some reason I rushed into buying this game simply because I've always wanted a fireworks simulator, and this looked really good from the screenshots and videos. But unfortunately it's just not as good as it makes it out to be. On the simple side, there are overused sounds, quite a limited set of fireworks and it's just simply overall quite a poor design for a simulator - it's more of a worktop or, do I call it a sandbox? On the technical side, it's even worse sadly, it takes up far much more GPU power than it needs to and the way it has been coded makes it hard to edit or even try open back something you've made without it causing errors, even for someone as tech-savy as me who understands the Windows Registry can't seem to even get it fixed. I had really high hopes for this game when I saw it released on Steam, but disappointed with the outcome even for a $10 game - overall I've spent less and received much better developed games.

number of helpful: 18 of 32 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												I don't normally write reviews on Steam games, but this game, really deserves it.Wow, what can I say? Fireworks Simulator is brand new into the market released only two days ago and come to think about it I'm sure your'e all thinking "well here's ANOTHER simulator game..."But let me stop you there, Fireworks Simulator is unlike anything I have ever played on Steam before and in a good way.Welcome to this crazy, psychedelic world of bright lights and explosions.I booted this up to try it and found myself 2 hours later in awe of a pretty awesome firework show I had built from scratch to music from my computer I had previously imported.If you buy this game be prepared to have your imagination captured, skills put to the test and most importantly have a lot of fun regardless of your age.I can assure you this is way more than placing pretty lights and watching them go bang.Unlike other "flop" simulator games I think this might just become a hit and the developers deserve every credit for it.The question is, can you top the London New Year Fireworks? You can certainly try!!

content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												Great potential.  Effects are beautifull.  But there is a lot of settings that is missing that would have improved the game a lot.  It is hard and unfriendly to use.The possibility of starting the "play" anywhere would let creator testing some effects instead of restarting the video everytime we need to see how it goes.  At les in the sequencer, instead of the pic of the place you are shooting, put a simulation of your show.Having the possibility to call effects directly in the sequencer and place it after would have been a great thing to have too.The is absolutely not enough effects to play with.  These effect should have more descriptions like time of the effect (I like the prefire time showed in sequencer by the way)  And shooting places is limited to 2, it is fastly becoming boring to make shows in these conditions.  I cant believe WECO put their name on that.  Experienced people should have seen the lack of possibilities of that game.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												First Impressions:The sequencer reminded me of "Roller Coaster Tycoon 3" a bit in that you can drop various fireworks onto a timeline.  "Fireworks Simulator" takes that a step further and adds the ability to adjust music and camera angles.  I would have really liked a freeform camera that let you zoom around to any position you wanted...instead you're limited to about six preset angles.  It's a solid simulator and it works once you figure it out, but I didn't see a whole lot of content.  For ten bucks, I'd have to give this a partial recommend...I think five would have been a bit more realistic.

												This is a great simulator. It has lots of shells to work with. The display graphics are great if you have a 2Gb video card or better. content:
Posted: January 23
Product received for free
												After mere minutes of playing this game, I feel that it in all honesty cannot be classified as a game. The term "masterpiece" comes to mind. I immediately closed this"masterpiece" in fears that I would become blinded with the sheer brilliance of this title. To the developers of this exquisite title I feel that I can only say one thing, congratulations. I received this game from a friend as what he classified as a "joke". The next day I saw him I hugged him and thanked him with tears in my eyes for blessing me this the experience that was playing 20 minutes of this game. To anyone hovering with their fingers poised over the "add to cart" button do not hesitate anymore. I cannot recommend this game highly enough to my friends, coworkers, complete strangers and the odd pyrotechnician that I encounter in my travels. Again thanks to the developers for enlightening me and the best of luck to any future title, and know that you have touched and influenced someone to see the beauty in this world.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												Worthwhile - if you know what you're letting yourself in for.This is a sim with many problems. The graphics are about as badly optimised as most of these sims, so it can get quite chuggy even with its relatively simple graphics; saving is very wobbly indeed and has a habit of wiping one's setups; the extremely repetitive background music can't be switched off without also muting the show soundtrack; user-configured racks don't have a simultaneous ignition option, and so on.But what works works fairly well, and there are some good ideas there. I like the fact that it shows an audio waveform to help line up the effects (though a slow option and step keys would be useful), and allows you to line up airbursts both by launch time and by detonation time. The graphics are rudimentary but look quite pretty within their limitations.It's not perfect. In many ways it's barefly functional. It's certainly not worth full price. And the devs seem to have abandoned it, so there's a big caveat emptor hanging over it. But I've had some fun with it, and if you catch it on sale you might too.
